alert.note: Alert for Atchison; Holt; Nodaway (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 4:28PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Atchison, Holt and western Nodaway Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 428 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rock Port to 7 miles west of Craig to near Goff. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tarkio, Mound City, Rock Port, Fairfax, Burlington Junction, Hopkins, Maitland, Skidmore, Craig, Clearmont, Elmo, Big Lake, Westboro, Quitman, Fortescue, Bigelow, Corning and Indian Cave State Park. This includes Interstate 29 between mile markers 78 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Kansas...and northwestern Missouri.
